metadata.Name: Russian Jeopardy! Data Set
metadata.Description: A Jeopardy!-like Russian Question Answering (QA) data set collected from the official Russian quiz database Chgk. The data set includes 379,284 quiz-like questions, with a specific subset of 29,375 questions from the Russian analogue of Jeopardy!, 'Own Game'. The questions are fact-oriented and test players' logic and erudition.
metadata.Paper Title: Russian Jeopardy! Data Set for Question-Answering Systems
metadata.Venue Title: Proceedings of the Language Resources and Evaluation Conference (LREC 2022)
metadata.Abstract: Question answering (QA) is one of the most common NLP tasks that relates to named entity recognition, fact extraction, semantic search and some other fields. In industry, it is much valued in chat-bots and corporate information systems. It is also a challenging task that attracted the attention of a very general audience at the quiz show Jeopardy! In this article we describe a Jeopardy!-like Russian QA data set collected from the official Russian quiz database Chgk che-ge-`ka:. The data set includes 379,284 quiz-like questions with 29,375 from the Russian analogue of Jeopardy! -- 'Own Game'. We observe its linguistic features and the related QA-task. We conclude about perspectives of a QA challenge based on the collected data set.
